result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant will comply with all federal, and state laws, and local alcohol, drug and violence ordinances during the period of this Agreement.  If there is a case charging a violation of a criminal statute or local ordinance pending when this agreement is due to expire, this agreement continues in effect until 30 days after such case is revolved.  If the Defendant is charged with a criminal offense in a case subsequent to the Court's approval of this agreement, a finding of probable cause in that case is sufficient basis for termination of this agreement. 
Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
The Defendant will participate in, follow the rules of, and complete the Pathways to Hope program as administered by the Superior Police Department. 
Defendant will continue to comply with all bail or bond conditions ordered by the Court while this agreement is in effect.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota James Buchanan

defendant.name: Buchanan, Dakota James
defendant.address: 7075 E Cnty Rd E, South Range, WI 54874

records.addlTxt: AND ARRAIGNMENT 10:08 AM Defendant Dakota James Buchanan in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Dakota James Buchanan.  Attorney Chad C La Lor appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews joint recommendation that defendant to plead to Count 1 and enter a deferred judgement of conviction. Count 2 to be dismissed. State reviews DJOC run until Dec 2023. Attorney Hoffman in agreement. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.  The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea.  The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement.
